title: Design of Gaze-Tracking Strategies to Enhance Multimedia Learning Effects in K-12 Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic multimedia learning theories and cognitive load theory
context.additional_context: Designing blended offline/online classes considering smartphone-based learning environments, with emphasis on analyzing application cases in the language domain.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the differences in cognitive load between integrated and separated text-image materials with 80% accuracy.
Learners can design multimedia learning scenarios using eye-tracking techniques at least twice.
Learners can propose three strategies to mitigate the divided-attention effect applicable in mobile learning environments.

resources: Online platform with smartphone-compatible interactive learning content templates
Offline materials kit for fingerprint tracking experiments
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
